description.plain: Zac Efron is an American actor and singer, best known for his role as Troy Bolton in the High School Musical franchise and as Phillip Carlyle in The Greatest Showman. He gained further notoriety after starring in Hairspray, 17 Again, Neighbors, and Baywatch.

body.plain: Zac Efron is an American actor and singer, best known for his role as Troy Bolton in the High School Musical franchise and as Phillip Carlyle in The Greatest Showman. He gained further notoriety after starring in Hairspray, 17 Again, Neighbors, and Baywatch.

songs.full_title: Rewrite the Stars by Zac Efron (Ft. Zendaya)
songs.title: Rewrite the Stars

description.plain:
“Rewrite the Stars” was the third promotional song to be released before The Greatest Showman premiered. It is the eighth song overall on the soundtrack.

The song is an aerial duet between two of the characters: Philip Carlyle, a rich, white man, and Anne Wheeler, a poor, African-American girl. The two are in love, but destiny seems to keep pulling them away from each other.

Lyrically, the song takes on the subject of controlling their own fate and not letting the “stars” (the stories they are “destined” to live) tell them otherwise. While Philip takes on a more optimistic tone, noting that they could “rewrite the stars” and change their destiny, Anne takes on a more realistic approach, believing that even though they love each other, no one can rewrite the stars or do the impossible.

songs.embed_content: Read “Rewrite the Stars” by Zac Efron on Genius

album.full_title: The Greatest Showman (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack) by Various Artists
album.name: The Greatest Showman (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack)

body.plain:
“Rewrite the Stars” was the third promotional song to be released before The Greatest Showman premiered. It is the eighth song overall on the soundtrack.

The song is an aerial duet between two of the characters: Philip Carlyle, a rich, white man, and Anne Wheeler, a poor, African-American girl. The two are in love, but destiny seems to keep pulling them away from each other.

Lyrically, the song takes on the subject of controlling their own fate and not letting the “stars” (the stories they are “destined” to live) tell them otherwise. songs.title: Rewrite the Stars (Acoustic Version)

songs.lyrics:
141 ContributorsRewrite the Stars Lyrics[Verse 1: Zac Efron]
You know I want you
It's not a secret I try to hide
I know you want me
So don't keep sayin' our hands are tied
You claim it's not in the cards
And fate is pulling you miles away and out of reach from me
But you're here in my heart
So who can stop me if I decide that you're my destiny?

[Chorus: Zac Efron]
What if we rewrite the stars?
Say you were made to be mine?
Nothing could keep us apart
You'd be the one I was meant to find
It's up to you and it's up to me
No one can say what we get to be
So why don't we rewrite the stars?
Maybe the world could be ours tonight

[Verse 2: Zendaya]
You think it's easy?
You think I don't want to run to you?
But there are mountains
And there are doors that we can't walk through
I know you're wonderin' why
Because we're able to be just you and me within these walls
But when we go outside
You're gonna wake up and see that it was hopeless after all
You might also like[Chorus: Zendaya]
No one can rewrite the stars
How can you say you'll be mine?
Everything keeps us apart
And I'm not the one you were meant to find
It's not up to you, it's not up to me
When everyone tells us what we can be
How can we rewrite the stars?
Say that the world can be ours tonight

[Bridge: Both, Zendaya, Zac Efron]
All I want is to fly with you
All I want is to fall with you
So just give me all of you
It feels impossible
It's not impossible
Is it impossible?
Say that it's possible

[Chorus: Both, Zac Efron]
How do we rewrite the stars?
Say you were made to be mine
Nothing can keep us apart
'Cause you are the one I was meant to find
It's up to you and it's up to me
No one can say what we get to be
Why don't we rewrite the stars?
Changin' the world to be ours
[Outro: Zendaya]
You know I want you
It's not a secret I try to hide
But I can't have you
We're bound to break and my hands are tied93Embed

songs.title: Ladies’ Choice

description.plain:
“Ladie’s Choice” is a new song for the 2007 film Hairspray specially written for Zac Efron. It was added to replace “The Madison,” a dance number carried over into the Broadway stage musical from the original non-musical 1988 Hairspray film.

The song is performed by Link at the segregated dance hall. During the number, Tracy’s dancing impresses Link and gets her on The Corny Collin’s Show.

songs.embed_content: Read “Ladies' Choice” by Zac Efron on Genius

It's gonna take cash to fill my tank (Gonna take cash to fill my tank)
So let's crack open your piggy bank (Let's crack open your piggy bank)
Hey little girl, you're window shopping
I got something traffic-stopping

Hey little girl, on a spending spree (Do)
I don't come cheap but the kisses come free (do)
On closer inspection, I'm sure that you'll agree

(Woo!)
